abstract: Fears that a U.S. economic slowdown could lead to lower energy consumption pushed oil down for a second day and the Dow gained more than 270 points.
snippet: Fears that a U.S. economic slowdown could lead to lower energy consumption pushed oil down for a second day and the Dow gained more than 270 points.
lead_paragraph: Fears that an economic slowdown in the United States could spread to other parts of the world and lead to lower energy consumption pushed oil prices down sharply for the second day on Wednesday.

headline.main: Slowdown Fears Push Oil Prices Down; Stocks Soar
headline.print_headline: Fears of a Slowdown Push Down Oil Prices

abstract: Concerns about an economic slowdown pushed oil down yet again, prompting a 2.5 percent jump in the Dow, amid new evidence of rising prices.
snippet: Concerns about an economic slowdown pushed oil down yet again, prompting a 2.5 percent jump in the Dow, amid new evidence of rising prices.
lead_paragraph: Concerns about a slowing economy and rising inflation pushed oil prices down sharply for a second day on Wednesday, an unusual dip in the oil price rally that began more than six years ago.

headline.main: Economic Fears Slice Oil Prices for Second Day
headline.print_headline: Economic Fears Slice Oil Prices For Second Day

byline.original: By Jad Mouawad and Michael M. Grynbaum
